data.content:
Aatrox (Default)


Release Date: N/A

Aatrox, the Darkin Blade, is a fearsome and ancient warrior in the world of League of Legends. As one of the original champions released in the game, Aatrox has become an iconic figure with a rich lore and a variety of skins that showcase his menacing presence. However, in this article, we will delve into the details of Aatrox's default skin, which serves as the foundation for his character design and story.

The default skin of Aatrox embodies his true form, showcasing his dark and brooding nature. Clad in dark armor with intricate designs, Aatrox exudes an aura of power and dominance. His massive wings, resembling those of a demonic creature, add to his imposing presence on the battlefield. The skin features a color palette dominated by shades of black, red, and silver, further emphasizing his connection to darkness and destruction.

Aatrox's default skin also highlights his signature weapon, the Darkin Blade. This massive sword is infused with dark energy, pulsating with power and malice. The intricate details on the blade, including the glowing runes and sharp edges, make it a formidable weapon capable of cleaving through enemies with ease. Aatrox wields the Darkin Blade with both hands, showcasing his immense strength and skill in combat.

In terms of visual effects, Aatrox's default skin features a range of abilities that complement his dark and menacing theme. His abilities are accompanied by dark energy and shadowy effects, adding an extra layer of intensity to his attacks. From his Q ability, The Darkin Blade, which sends out a devastating shockwave, to his ultimate ability, World Ender, which transforms him into a monstrous form, each ability animation is carefully crafted to enhance the player's experience and immersion in the game.

Now that we have explored the details of Aatrox's default skin, let's take a moment to delve into the lore and story behind this formidable champion. Aatrox is one of the five Darkin, ancient and powerful beings who were once revered as gods. However, their thirst for power corrupted them, turning them into malevolent entities seeking destruction and chaos.

Aatrox, in particular, was a renowned warrior who fought alongside his brethren in countless battles. He wielded the Darkin Blade, a weapon of immense power, and was feared by both allies and enemies alike. However, as the Darkin's corruption grew, Aatrox and his kin were sealed away in their weapons by the mortal races, hoping to contain their destructive influence.

Centuries later, Aatrox's prison was shattered, and he was released into the world once again. Fueled by vengeance and a desire to unleash chaos, Aatrox seeks to bring ruin to all who stand in his way. With his immense strength and mastery of the Darkin Blade, he is a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield.

In the game, Aatrox is classified as a melee fighter, excelling in close-quarters combat. His abilities allow him to deal significant damage to multiple enemies while sustaining himself through his innate healing abilities. Aatrox's strengths lie in his ability to engage and disrupt the enemy team, providing crowd control and damage output in team fights. However, he is also vulnerable to crowd control effects and relies heavily on landing his skill shots to maximize his damage potential.

Aatrox's place in the game is that of a high-risk, high-reward champion. Skilled players who can effectively utilize his abilities and position themselves well in team fights can dominate the battlefield and turn the tide of the game in their favor. However, inexperienced players may find it challenging to fully unleash Aatrox's potential, as his kit requires precise timing and positioning to be effective.

In conclusion, Aatrox's default skin serves as the foundation for his character design and story. With its dark and brooding aesthetic, it perfectly captures the essence of this ancient and powerful warrior. Whether you choose to wield the Darkin Blade and unleash chaos or stand against the forces of darkness, Aatrox's default skin is a testament to his formidable presence on the battlefield.

For more information and videos showcasing all of Aatrox's appearances, including his various skins, be sure to visit this page. Explore the depths of his lore and master his abilities to become a true force of destruction in the world of League of Legends.

Aatrox (Mecha Aatrox)


Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: August 22, 2019

Mecha Aatrox is a legendary skin for the champion Aatrox in the popular online game League of Legends. Released on August 22, 2019, this skin offers a futuristic and mechanized look for the Darkin Blade, transforming him into a powerful and imposing robotic warrior. With its unique visual effects, animations, and sound effects, Mecha Aatrox provides players with an exciting and immersive experience in the game.

The Mecha Aatrox skin features a complete overhaul of the champion's appearance, turning him into a fearsome mechanical entity. Aatrox's armor is replaced with sleek, metallic plating, adorned with glowing blue accents. His wings are transformed into mechanical constructs, resembling jet engines, which emit a fiery glow as he soars through the battlefield. The Darkin Blade itself is reimagined as a massive, energy-infused mechanical sword, pulsating with power and ready to strike down any foe.

In addition to the visual changes, Mecha Aatrox also introduces new animations and sound effects. His abilities are enhanced with futuristic technology, creating a unique and satisfying gameplay experience. The sound of his mechanical movements and devastating attacks further immerses players into the world of Mecha Aatrox, making every action feel impactful and powerful.

Aatrox, the champion behind the Mecha Aatrox skin, is a formidable warrior in the League of Legends universe. Once a noble and powerful being, Aatrox was corrupted by dark forces and transformed into a fearsome Darkin Blade. He seeks vengeance and destruction, wielding his immense power to annihilate his enemies on the battlefield.

Aatrox possesses incredible strength and durability, making him a formidable force in combat. His abilities allow him to deal massive damage to multiple enemies at once, while also sustaining himself through his life-stealing abilities. Aatrox's ultimate ability, World Ender, empowers him with increased attack damage and a resurrection effect, making him even more dangerous in team fights.

However, Aatrox also has his weaknesses. He relies heavily on landing his skill shots to maximize his damage output, making him vulnerable to champions with high mobility or the ability to dodge his attacks. Additionally, Aatrox's abilities have relatively long cooldowns, requiring careful management to ensure he is not left defenseless in crucial moments.

In the game, Aatrox is often played in the top lane, where his strong laning presence and ability to dominate melee matchups make him a popular pick. His crowd control abilities and high damage output also make him a valuable asset in team fights, where he can disrupt the enemy team and deal significant damage to multiple targets.

If you want to learn more about Aatrox and his various appearances in the game, you can find detailed information and videos on his champion page. Whether it's the menacing Mecha Aatrox or any other skin, Aatrox offers a thrilling and powerful gameplay experience for those who dare to wield the Darkin Blade.

Aatrox


Release Date: June 13, 2013

Aatrox, the Darkin Blade, is a fearsome and ancient warrior in the world of League of Legends. With his massive sword and demonic powers, he strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies. Aatrox is a melee fighter who excels at sustained damage and crowd control, making him a formidable force on the battlefield.

Aatrox's story is shrouded in mystery and legend. He is one of the five Darkin, a group of powerful and malevolent beings who were imprisoned in their weapons by the ancient Targonians. Aatrox's weapon, a massive and bloodthirsty sword, was said to have been forged in the fires of the celestial realm. When the Darkin were released from their imprisonment, Aatrox emerged as a vengeful and wrathful warrior, seeking to bring chaos and destruction to the world.

In the game, Aatrox is known for his incredible sustain and dueling potential. His passive ability, Blood Well, allows him to store blood as he deals and takes damage. When his Blood Well is full, Aatrox gains bonus attack damage and a revive effect upon death. This makes him incredibly difficult to kill and allows him to turn fights in his favor even when outnumbered.

Aatrox's Q ability, The Darkin Blade, allows him to strike with his massive sword, dealing damage to enemies in a line. This ability can be cast up to three times in quick succession, allowing Aatrox to unleash devastating combos and quickly dispatch his foes. Additionally, each cast of The Darkin Blade increases Aatrox's attack speed, further enhancing his damage output.

His W ability, Infernal Chains, allows Aatrox to immobilize and damage a target enemy champion. If the ability is successfully landed, Aatrox can reactivate it to pull himself towards the target, dealing additional damage. This ability is crucial for Aatrox's crowd control and lockdown potential, allowing him to isolate and eliminate priority targets in team fights.

Aatrox's E ability, Umbral Dash, grants him increased mobility and the ability to dash through enemies. This ability not only allows Aatrox to reposition himself in fights but also deals damage to enemies he passes through. It can be used both offensively and defensively, making it a versatile tool in Aatrox's kit.

Finally, Aatrox's ultimate ability, World Ender, transforms him into a terrifying and unstoppable force. Upon activation, Aatrox gains bonus attack damage, increased movement speed, and a massive area-of-effect explosion upon taking down an enemy champion. This ultimate ability turns Aatrox into a true raid boss, capable of decimating entire teams if left unchecked.

Aatrox's strengths lie in his sustain, dueling potential, and team fight presence. His ability to heal and revive himself makes him incredibly difficult to kill, allowing him to stay in fights for extended periods of time. His crowd control and damage output make him a threat to squishy targets, while his ultimate ability turns him into a force to be reckoned with in team fights.

However, Aatrox does have weaknesses that can be exploited by skilled opponents. His abilities have relatively high cooldowns, making him vulnerable during their downtime. Additionally, his reliance on landing skill shots means that he can be easily dodged by champions with high mobility. Aatrox is also susceptible to crowd control and burst damage, as his sustain relies on dealing damage to enemies.

In the world of League of Legends, Aatrox holds a unique place as one of the Darkin, ancient and powerful beings with a thirst for destruction. His lore and gameplay make him a captivating and formidable champion to play. If you want to learn more about Aatrox and his various skins, you can visit our website where you can find detailed information and videos showcasing all of his available skins.

Aatrox (Lunar Eclipse Aatrox)


RP Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: January 10, 2019

The Lunar Eclipse Aatrox skin is a visually stunning and thematically fitting addition to the League of Legends universe. Released on January 10, 2019, this skin offers players a unique and captivating look for the Darkin Blade. With its celestial-inspired design, Lunar Eclipse Aatrox embodies the power and elegance of the moon, making it a must-have for Aatrox enthusiasts and collectors alike.

As the name suggests, Lunar Eclipse Aatrox draws inspiration from the celestial event that occurs when the Earth passes between the sun and the moon, casting a shadow on the lunar surface. This skin showcases Aatrox in a new light, transforming him into a cosmic warrior with a dark and mysterious aura.

The Lunar Eclipse Aatrox skin features a complete visual overhaul, including new model textures, spell effects, animations, and sound effects. Aatrox's armor is adorned with intricate lunar symbols and his wings are transformed into ethereal, moonlit appendages. The skin also introduces new voice lines, adding an extra layer of immersion to the gameplay experience.

One of the standout features of Lunar Eclipse Aatrox is the unique recall animation. When Aatrox recalls, he ascends into the sky, surrounded by a swirling vortex of lunar energy. This animation perfectly captures the celestial theme of the skin and adds a touch of grandeur to Aatrox's gameplay.

Now, let's delve into the story of Aatrox and his place in the League of Legends universe. Aatrox is a champion known for his immense power and relentless aggression. He is one of the five Darkin, ancient and malevolent beings who were once revered as gods. Aatrox, in particular, is the Darkin Blade, a fearsome warrior who wields a massive sword infused with dark magic.

In the lore of League of Legends, Aatrox was once a noble and honorable warrior who fought alongside his brethren to protect the world from the Void. However, after being corrupted by the very magic he sought to wield against the Void, Aatrox became a twisted and vengeful being. He now seeks to bring chaos and destruction to the world, reveling in the bloodshed and suffering he causes.

In the game, Aatrox is a melee fighter who excels at sustained damage and crowd control. His abilities allow him to engage enemies with devastating strikes and disrupt their movements with his crowd control effects. Aatrox's ultimate ability, World Ender, transforms him into a monstrous form, granting him increased attack damage, healing, and the ability to revive upon taking fatal damage.

While Aatrox is a formidable champion, he does have his weaknesses. His abilities have relatively high cooldowns, making him vulnerable during the downtime between casts. Additionally, Aatrox relies heavily on landing his skillshots to maximize his damage output, making him susceptible to champions with high mobility or the ability to dodge his attacks.

Despite his dark and destructive nature, Aatrox has become an iconic figure in the League of Legends universe. His lore and gameplay have captivated players, and his unique appearance has made him a popular choice for cosplayers and fan artists. With the addition of the Lunar Eclipse Aatrox skin, players now have the opportunity to experience Aatrox in a whole new light, embracing the celestial power that lies within him.

For more information about Aatrox and to see all of his appearances in the game, including the Lunar Eclipse Aatrox skin, be sure to visit our dedicated page. Watch videos, explore his abilities, and immerse yourself in the dark and captivating world of Aatrox.

Aatrox (Odyssey Aatrox)


RP: 1350 | Release Date: September 12, 2018

The Odyssey Aatrox skin is a visually stunning and thematically fitting addition to Aatrox's arsenal. Released on September 12, 2018, this skin offers players a chance to experience Aatrox in a whole new light, as he takes on the futuristic and space-themed Odyssey theme. With its unique visual effects, animations, and sound effects, the Odyssey Aatrox skin truly stands out among Aatrox's other appearances.

The Odyssey Aatrox skin transforms the Darkin Blade into a sleek, futuristic weapon that glows with an otherworldly energy. Aatrox himself dons a high-tech armor, complete with glowing blue accents and intricate details. The skin also features new visual effects for Aatrox's abilities, such as his Q (The Darkin Blade), W (Infernal Chains), E (Umbral Dash), and R (World Ender). These effects are designed to match the futuristic theme, creating a visually stunning experience for players.

In addition to the visual upgrades, the Odyssey Aatrox skin also introduces new sound effects for Aatrox's abilities. The sound of his blade slicing through the air, the impact of his abilities, and the voice lines have all been modified to fit the futuristic theme. These changes further enhance the immersive experience of playing as Odyssey Aatrox.

Now, let's delve into the story of Aatrox and how he fits into the world of League of Legends. Aatrox is a champion known for his immense power and destructive nature. He is one of the Darkin, ancient and powerful beings who were once revered as gods. However, Aatrox's story takes a tragic turn when he and his fellow Darkin are betrayed and imprisoned by mortals.

Centuries later, Aatrox is freed from his prison and seeks revenge on those who wronged him. He wields the Darkin Blade, a weapon of immense power that thirsts for bloodshed. Aatrox's abilities reflect his relentless and brutal nature, allowing him to deal devastating damage to his enemies while sustaining himself through his life-stealing abilities.

In the game, Aatrox is primarily played as a top lane champion. His strengths lie in his ability to engage in fights and deal massive damage to multiple enemies at once. His Q ability, The Darkin Blade, allows him to swing his sword in a wide arc, damaging and knocking up enemies in its path. His W ability, Infernal Chains, allows him to immobilize and damage a single target, making it easier for him to secure kills. His E ability, Umbral Dash, grants him mobility and a brief period of invulnerability, allowing him to dodge enemy abilities and reposition himself in fights. Finally, his ultimate ability, World Ender, empowers him, increasing his size, damage, and healing capabilities.

However, Aatrox also has weaknesses that players must be aware of. He is relatively immobile compared to other champions, making him vulnerable to crowd control effects and kiting. Additionally, his abilities have long cooldowns, meaning that mistimed or wasted abilities can leave him vulnerable in fights. Aatrox's reliance on his abilities also makes him susceptible to champions who can silence or interrupt his abilities, denying him the opportunity to deal damage and sustain himself.

In conclusion, the Odyssey Aatrox skin offers players a visually stunning and immersive experience, allowing them to play as a futuristic version of the powerful Darkin champion. With its unique visual and sound effects, this skin truly stands out among Aatrox's other appearances. Whether you're a fan of Aatrox or simply looking for a visually impressive skin, the Odyssey Aatrox skin is definitely worth considering.

For more information and videos showcasing all of Aatrox's appearances, be sure to visit this page.

Aatrox (Blood Moon Aatrox)


RP: 1350 | Release Date: February 7, 2019

The Blood Moon Aatrox skin is a visually stunning and thematically fitting addition to Aatrox's arsenal. Released on February 7, 2019, this skin offers players a chance to experience the dark and mysterious allure of the Blood Moon cult. With its intricate design and unique animations, Blood Moon Aatrox is a must-have for any Aatrox enthusiast.

The Blood Moon Aatrox skin transforms the Darkin Blade into a wickedly curved, blood-red weapon. The blade is adorned with intricate patterns and symbols, giving it an otherworldly and menacing appearance. Aatrox himself is also given a makeover, with his armor taking on a crimson hue and his wings becoming more ethereal and ghostly. The skin's visual effects are equally impressive, with blood-red particles and a hauntingly beautiful recall animation that showcases Aatrox's connection to the Blood Moon cult.

In addition to its stunning visuals, Blood Moon Aatrox also features unique sound effects that further enhance the skin's theme. The sound of slashing and slicing is accompanied by eerie whispers and chants, immersing players in the dark and mysterious atmosphere of the Blood Moon cult. The voiceover for Blood Moon Aatrox is also modified, with Aatrox's lines taking on a more sinister and haunting tone, perfectly capturing the essence of the Blood Moon theme.

Now, let's delve into the story of Aatrox and his place in the League of Legends universe. Aatrox is a champion known for his immense power and relentless aggression. He is one of the Darkin, ancient and malevolent beings who were imprisoned within their weapons after losing a cataclysmic war against the mortal races. Aatrox, once a noble warrior, was corrupted by his thirst for vengeance and became a terrifying force of destruction.

In the game, Aatrox is a melee fighter who excels at sustained damage and crowd control. His abilities allow him to engage enemies with devastating strikes and disrupt their movements with his crowd control abilities. Aatrox's passive ability, Blood Well, grants him a temporary resurrection upon taking fatal damage, allowing him to continue fighting even in the face of death. His ultimate ability, World Ender, empowers him with increased attack damage and movement speed, making him a formidable threat in team fights.

Aatrox's story is one of tragedy and vengeance, as he seeks to unleash his wrath upon the world that imprisoned him. His place in the League of Legends universe is that of a fearsome and relentless warrior, a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. With his Blood Moon Aatrox skin, players can embody the dark and mysterious nature of this champion, immersing themselves in the lore and aesthetics of the Blood Moon cult.

On this page, you can find information and videos about all of Aatrox's appearances, including the Blood Moon Aatrox skin. Whether you're a fan of his base design or interested in exploring the different thematic variations of this champion, this page is your go-to resource for all things Aatrox. Immerse yourself in the world of League of Legends and discover the power and darkness that lies within Aatrox and his Blood Moon incarnation.

Aatrox (DRX Aatrox)


RP: 1350 | Release Date: September 24, 2020

The DRX Aatrox skin is a visually stunning and thematically fitting addition to the League of Legends universe. Released on September 24, 2020, this skin allows players to embody the powerful and menacing presence of Aatrox, the Darkin Blade, in the colors and style of the DRX esports team. With its unique design and captivating animations, DRX Aatrox is a must-have for fans of both Aatrox and the DRX organization.

The DRX Aatrox skin transforms the already formidable champion into a fearsome warrior adorned in the iconic black and red colors of the DRX team. Aatrox's armor is enhanced with sleek and modern details, giving him a more futuristic appearance. The skin also features custom particle effects, ability animations, and sound effects that perfectly complement the DRX theme. From the moment you spawn into the game, you'll feel the power and intensity of DRX Aatrox as you dominate the battlefield.

In addition to the visual enhancements, DRX Aatrox also comes with unique recall animation. When Aatrox recalls, he is enveloped in a swirling vortex of energy, showcasing his connection to the Darkin Blade and his mastery over the battlefield. This recall animation adds an extra layer of immersion and personality to the skin, making it even more satisfying to play.

Now, let's delve into the story of Aatrox and his place in the League of Legends universe. Aatrox, once a noble and powerful warrior, was betrayed and corrupted by dark forces, transforming him into a vengeful and bloodthirsty being. He wields the massive and deadly Darkin Blade, seeking to exact his revenge on those who wronged him. Aatrox's story is one of tragedy and despair, as he is trapped in an eternal cycle of destruction and resurrection.

In the game, Aatrox is a melee fighter known for his high damage output and sustain. His abilities allow him to engage enemies with devastating strikes and drain their life force to heal himself. Aatrox's ultimate ability, World Ender, empowers him with increased attack damage, movement speed, and the ability to revive upon taking fatal damage. This makes him a formidable force in team fights, capable of turning the tide of battle in his favor.

However, Aatrox also has his weaknesses. He is heavily reliant on landing his skillshots to maximize his damage output, making him vulnerable to champions with high mobility or the ability to dodge his attacks. Additionally, Aatrox's sustain is tied to hitting his abilities, so if he misses his skillshots or is unable to engage in combat, he becomes significantly weaker. Players must carefully position themselves and time their abilities to make the most out of Aatrox's kit.

In the League of Legends community, Aatrox has become a popular pick for players who enjoy high-risk, high-reward gameplay. His unique playstyle and powerful abilities make him a satisfying champion to master. Whether you prefer to dominate the top lane or wreak havoc in team fights, Aatrox offers a versatile and exciting experience.

If you're interested in learning more about Aatrox and his various appearances in the game, you can find detailed information and videos on this page. Explore the different skins and discover the visual and thematic changes that each one brings to the champion. Whether you're a fan of the DRX Aatrox skin or want to explore other options, this page is your go-to resource for all things Aatrox.

Aatrox (Victorious Aatrox)


RP Cost: 1350 | Release Date: November 2021

The Victorious Aatrox skin is a highly sought-after cosmetic item in the popular online game League of Legends. This skin was released in November 2021 and is available for purchase at a cost of 1350 RP. With its unique design and stunning visual effects, Victorious Aatrox offers players a chance to showcase their skill and dedication as they dominate the battlefield with this fearsome champion.

The Victorious Aatrox skin is a testament to the power and might of this dark and brooding champion. Aatrox, also known as the Darkin Blade, is a formidable warrior who wields a massive greatsword with deadly precision. This skin takes his menacing presence to a whole new level, with its sleek black armor adorned with gold accents and intricate details. The skin also features glowing red eyes and a set of imposing wings, giving Aatrox an even more intimidating appearance.

In addition to its visually striking design, Victorious Aatrox also comes with a range of new animations and sound effects. Each of Aatrox's abilities has been reimagined to match the theme of the skin, creating a truly immersive experience for players. From the moment you unleash Aatrox's devastating Q ability, The Darkin Blade, to the final moments of battle as you activate his ultimate ability, World Ender, every action feels impactful and satisfying.

Now, let's delve into the story of Aatrox and his place in the League of Legends universe. Aatrox is one of the Darkin, ancient and powerful beings who were once revered as gods. However, their thirst for power corrupted them, turning them into monstrous entities consumed by darkness. Aatrox, once a noble warrior, was twisted into a vengeful and bloodthirsty creature after the fall of his civilization.

In the game, Aatrox is a melee fighter who excels at dealing damage and sustaining himself in battle. His abilities allow him to engage enemies with devastating strikes, while also providing him with the means to heal and survive. Aatrox's passive ability, Deathbringer Stance, empowers his attacks and grants him increased attack speed. His Q ability, The Darkin Blade, allows him to strike enemies in a wide arc, dealing damage and knocking them up. Aatrox's W ability, Infernal Chains, tethers him to an enemy, damaging them and immobilizing them if they fail to escape. His E ability, Umbral Dash, allows him to dash through enemies, dealing damage and gaining a temporary speed boost. Finally, Aatrox's ultimate ability, World Ender, empowers him, increasing his size, granting bonus attack damage, and reviving him upon taking fatal damage.

Aatrox's playstyle revolves around aggressive engagements and sustained damage. He excels in team fights, where his area-of-effect abilities can wreak havoc on multiple enemies at once. However, Aatrox is not without his weaknesses. He is vulnerable to crowd control effects, as they can interrupt his abilities and prevent him from dealing damage. Additionally, Aatrox relies heavily on landing his Q ability to maximize his damage output, making him susceptible to opponents who can dodge or evade his attacks.

In the lore of League of Legends, Aatrox's story is one of tragedy and vengeance. He seeks to exact revenge on those who betrayed and destroyed his civilization, and his path is one of bloodshed and destruction. Aatrox's presence in the game reflects his relentless pursuit of power and his desire to bring ruin to his enemies. With the Victorious Aatrox skin, players can embody the essence of this dark and formidable champion, showcasing their skill and dominance on the battlefield.

To learn more about Aatrox and his various appearances in League of Legends, including the Victorious Aatrox skin, you can visit our page dedicated to this powerful champion. There, you will find detailed information, videos, and more, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in the world of Aatrox and experience the thrill of playing as this fearsome warrior.

Aatrox (Justicar Aatrox)


RP Cost: 975 RP | Release Date: August 1, 2013

Justicar Aatrox, the righteous embodiment of justice, is a skin that brings a new level of elegance and power to the Darkin Blade. Released on August 1, 2013, this skin offers players a visually stunning and thematically fitting alternative to Aatrox's default appearance. With its intricate design and vibrant colors, Justicar Aatrox is a must-have for any fan of the Darkin Blade.

Justicar Aatrox features a complete visual overhaul, transforming Aatrox into a celestial warrior of justice. The skin showcases Aatrox in a white and gold armor adorned with intricate patterns and glowing blue accents. His wings, instead of the usual dark and menacing appearance, are now radiant and ethereal, giving him an angelic presence on the battlefield. The Darkin Blade itself is transformed into a gleaming weapon of light, radiating power and righteousness.

Not only does Justicar Aatrox offer a visually stunning experience, but it also enhances the overall gameplay experience. The skin's animations and effects have been carefully crafted to match its celestial theme. Aatrox's abilities now leave behind trails of shimmering light, and his recall animation showcases his wings spreading wide as he ascends into the heavens. These small details add an extra layer of immersion and satisfaction to playing as Justicar Aatrox.

Now, let's delve into the story of Aatrox and how he came to possess the Justicar Aatrox skin. Aatrox, known as the Darkin Blade, is a legendary and ancient being from the world of Runeterra. He is one of the five Darkin, powerful and malevolent entities that were once revered as gods. Aatrox, in particular, was a warrior who fought alongside mortals in countless battles, granting them strength and victory in exchange for their loyalty.

However, Aatrox's true nature was revealed when he betrayed those he had sworn to protect. He reveled in the chaos and destruction of war, delighting in the suffering of mortals. Aatrox's actions led to his kind being sealed away, their weapons shattered, and their names erased from history. But Aatrox, the Darkin Blade, endured.

Over the centuries, Aatrox's essence found its way into a new host, a warrior who sought power and vengeance. This host became the vessel through which Aatrox would once again wreak havoc upon Runeterra. However, the celestial forces of justice could not stand idly by as Aatrox unleashed his dark power.

Thus, the Justicar Aatrox skin represents a manifestation of the celestial forces' attempt to contain and control the Darkin Blade. It is a symbol of their desire to bring justice and order to the chaos that Aatrox embodies. The celestial armor and radiant wings serve as a reminder that even the most malevolent beings can be brought to heel by the forces of righteousness.

In the world of League of Legends, Aatrox is a formidable champion who excels in close-quarters combat. His kit revolves around his ability to sustain himself in battle and deal devastating damage to his enemies. Aatrox's passive, Blood Well, allows him to revive upon taking fatal damage, giving him a second chance to turn the tide of battle. His Q ability, The Darkin Blade, empowers his next basic attack, dealing bonus damage and knocking up enemies in its path.

Aatrox's W ability, Infernal Chains, allows him to immobilize and damage a target, while also healing himself based on the damage dealt. His E ability, Umbral Dash, allows him to dash through enemies, dealing damage and gaining a temporary boost to his attack speed. Finally, his ultimate ability, World Ender, transforms Aatrox into a monstrous form, granting him bonus attack damage, increased healing, and the ability to revive from his passive more quickly.

Despite his immense power, Aatrox does have weaknesses. He is heavily reliant on landing his abilities to maximize his damage output and sustain. Additionally, his lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to crowd control and kiting. Aatrox players must carefully position themselves and time their abilities to make the most of his kit.

Overall, Aatrox is a champion with a rich lore and a unique playstyle. Whether you choose to embrace the darkness of his default appearance or embody the celestial forces of justice with the Justicar Aatrox skin, Aatrox offers a thrilling and satisfying experience on the Fields of Justice.

For more information about Aatrox and to see all of his appearances in action, be sure to visit our page dedicated to the Darkin Blade. Watch videos, learn about his abilities, and discover the many ways you can dominate the battlefield as Aatrox.

Aatrox (Sea Hunter Aatrox)


Cost: 1350 RP | Release Date: July 10, 2014

The Sea Hunter Aatrox skin is a visually stunning and thematically fitting addition to the League of Legends universe. Released on July 10, 2014, this skin allows players to embody the fearsome Aatrox as a formidable sea creature, ready to conquer the depths of the ocean. With its unique design and captivating animations, Sea Hunter Aatrox offers a refreshing take on the Darkin Blade's appearance.

Sea Hunter Aatrox is adorned with a striking aquatic color palette, featuring shades of deep blue and vibrant turquoise. The skin showcases Aatrox as a menacing underwater predator, with his wings transformed into fins and his blade resembling a sharp, jagged coral reef. The attention to detail is evident in every aspect of the skin, from the intricate scales on Aatrox's body to the swirling water effects that accompany his abilities.

The animations of Sea Hunter Aatrox are fluid and captivating, further enhancing the skin's appeal. As Aatrox moves across the battlefield, his wings elegantly glide through the air, mimicking the movement of a shark's fins. When he activates his abilities, water surges around him, emphasizing his power and dominance. The recall animation is particularly noteworthy, as Aatrox dives into the ground, disappearing beneath the waves before resurfacing with renewed vigor.

Now, let's delve into the story of Aatrox, the Darkin Blade, and his place in the League of Legends universe. Aatrox is a champion shrouded in mystery and darkness, known for his immense power and thirst for battle. He is one of the five Darkin, ancient and malevolent beings who were imprisoned within their weapons after a devastating war. Aatrox's weapon of choice is a massive greatsword, which he wields with deadly precision.

In the game, Aatrox is a melee fighter who excels at sustained damage and crowd control. His abilities allow him to engage enemies head-on, dealing significant damage while sustaining himself through his Blood Well mechanic. Aatrox's strengths lie in his ability to initiate team fights, diving into the enemy backline and disrupting their formation. His weaknesses, however, stem from his reliance on his Blood Well and the need to carefully manage his resources to maximize his effectiveness.

Aatrox's past in the game is intertwined with the lore of the Darkin and their eternal struggle for freedom. Once a noble warrior, Aatrox was corrupted by the power of his weapon, becoming a vessel for the Darkin's insatiable bloodlust. He seeks to break free from his prison and unleash chaos upon the world. Aatrox's story is one of tragedy and despair, as he battles against his own nature while yearning for release.

In the League of Legends universe, Aatrox holds a significant place as one of the iconic champions. His imposing presence and unique playstyle make him a favorite among players who enjoy high-risk, high-reward gameplay. Aatrox's versatility allows him to be played in various roles, including top lane and jungle, making him a valuable asset in team compositions.

The Story of Prestige Blood Moon Aatrox

The Blood Moon is a powerful and ancient ritual that takes place in Ionia, a land known for its rich spiritual traditions. It is a time when the barrier between the physical and spiritual realms weakens, allowing malevolent spirits to roam freely. The Blood Moon cult, a group of dark worshippers, seeks to harness this energy and gain immense power. In their quest for dominance, they have made a pact with Aatrox, the Darkin Blade.

The Prestige Blood Moon Aatrox skin represents the culmination of this unholy alliance. Aatrox, once a noble warrior, has succumbed to the allure of the Blood Moon's dark power. His armor is adorned with intricate red and gold designs, symbolizing the bloodshed and sacrifice that fuels his strength. The skin features unique animations and spell effects, immersing players in the sinister atmosphere of the Blood Moon ritual.

As players unleash Aatrox's devastating abilities, they will witness the terrifying transformation of the Darkin Blade. Each strike becomes a spectacle of crimson energy, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. The Prestige Blood Moon Aatrox skin truly embodies the essence of the Blood Moon cult, offering players a chance to experience the dark allure of this ancient ritual firsthand.


Aatrox: The Fallen World Ender

Aatrox, also known as the World Ender, is a champion in League of Legends who wields a massive greatsword and possesses immense power. Once a noble and righteous warrior, Aatrox was betrayed and imprisoned by those he sought to protect. Over the centuries, his anger and despair transformed him into a vengeful being, seeking only destruction and chaos.

In the game, Aatrox is a formidable top lane champion who excels in extended fights and team battles. His kit revolves around dealing massive damage while sustaining himself through his abilities. Aatrox's Q ability, The Darkin Blade, allows him to strike enemies in a wide arc, damaging and knocking them up. His W ability, Infernal Chains, tethers enemies to the ground, immobilizing them and dealing damage over time. Aatrox's E ability, Umbral Dash, enables him to dash forward and unleash a powerful attack, while his ultimate ability, World Ender, grants him increased attack damage, movement speed, and a self-revive upon taking fatal damage.

Aatrox's strengths lie in his ability to dominate team fights and duel opponents with his sustained damage output. His crowd control and self-sustain make him a formidable force on the battlefield. However, Aatrox is not without weaknesses. He is vulnerable to crowd control effects that can interrupt his abilities and prevent him from unleashing his full potential. Additionally, his reliance on landing skill shots makes him susceptible to agile opponents who can dodge his attacks.

Throughout his existence in League of Legends, Aatrox has undergone several changes and updates to his kit, ensuring that he remains a balanced and engaging champion for players to master. His lore and story have also evolved, revealing more about his tragic past and his role in the world of Runeterra.

Now, let's delve into the story of Aatrox himself. Aatrox is a champion with a tragic past and a relentless desire for revenge. Once a proud and noble warrior, he fought alongside his brethren in an ancient war against the forces of darkness. However, Aatrox and his fellow Darkin were betrayed by those they fought to protect.

Imprisoned and stripped of their power, the Darkin were left to languish in their eternal torment. But Aatrox refused to accept his fate. He managed to break free from his prison, but at a great cost. His physical form was shattered, and he was forced to bind his essence to a massive blade.

Now, Aatrox seeks to unleash his vengeance upon the world. He revels in the chaos and destruction he brings, using his immense strength and dark powers to obliterate his enemies. Aatrox's abilities are centered around his massive blade, allowing him to cleave through multiple foes and sustain himself through the bloodshed.

In the game, Aatrox is primarily played in the top lane, where his high damage output and sustain make him a formidable opponent. His Q ability, The Darkin Blade, allows him to strike the ground, damaging and knocking up enemies in a line. His W ability, Infernal Chains, tethers an enemy champion, dealing damage and immobilizing them if they fail to escape the chains.

Aatrox's E ability, Umbral Dash, allows him to dash forward and gain increased attack damage. This ability also enhances his next basic attack, making it a powerful tool for engaging or disengaging from fights. Finally, his ultimate ability, World Ender, empowers Aatrox, granting him increased attack damage, movement speed, and the ability to revive upon taking fatal damage.

While Aatrox is a formidable champion, he does have his weaknesses. His abilities have relatively high cooldowns, making him vulnerable during their downtime. Additionally, Aatrox relies heavily on hitting his skillshots to maximize his damage output, so skilled opponents who can dodge his abilities can effectively neutralize him.
